rComments: Prof had a very enjoyable class. Lectures were a little dry but they had everything you needed for the class in them. Assignments were largely based on DGDs so make sure you attend them all. Basically if you do all of the available work you'll be fine.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Participation matters', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: This was one of the worst classes I have ever taken. He cannot explain concepts to save his life, all he does is read of his PowerPoint for 1.5 hours. There is no textbook so it makes it incredibly difficult to understand the material. Over just a horrible class that I would have dropped if it was not compulsory.

This was one of the worst classes I've ever had, I have almost lost all interest in linguistics. Not only does the professor make the content extra confusing, he marks you on participation when there barely isn't any room to participate in class or interact. He also pretty much made the discussion groups mandatory, which I did not appreciate.

Good man, terrible prof. He seems to care about this students but he genuinely cannot explain things well for the life of him. I had him for syntax and i hated every moment of it, i would have failed if not for the amazing TA.

Hes a very kind person, and seems to care about students however, he has no idea how to explain concepts or help students who are struggling. His class averages are extremely low and does nothing about it. Students who dont succeed in his class are a result of him, all he does is read his slides.
Super nice professor, not a tough grader. lectures were a little lengthy but not a big deal.
Hes really nice but sometimes he doesnt explain the best but the power points help a lot. Grading criterias arent so clear. Otherwise, hes a pretty good prof.

He's got good intentions, but is terrible at explanations. Most of my questions either go unanswered or he'll just say"You did/will do this in the DGD", which is infuriating because the way he phrases the questions in assignments is so different from the ones in his slides and the DGD exercises. Would have dropped the course if it wasn't for the TA

first half of the term you don't need to show up to the lectures because you can easily understand from the slides. Midterm was simple too, but be more precise with your answers(which are on the slides). Second half of the term go to DGDS. overall his class SUCKED and you'll hate every single second of your life in his lecture. good luck!!!

Overall ok, monotone but honestly tries to be engaging. Has a hard time expressing himself in english (stutters, doesnt finish sentence). Reads from slides every class but interesting material. Goes through examples in class. You can tell he cares but hes not the best lecturer. DGDs help alot and hmwrk is mostly clear/easy. Monotone dresser tho :)

This prof is really nice and filled with good intentions, but can be monotoned. Because his power-points are so complete and heavy, he did not add additional information in class. Therefore, I did not see the need to show up in class, because all the information was in the power-point. This course has a lot of rote learning but pretty fun.

Not a bad guy, just not the best prof. His powerpoints contain the most basic information and leave out the required information to really learn the material. If you just use the textbooks he gives you, they give better info than Gustavo.

I really liked him as a person because he really liked me and was really friendly, but he was not amazing at explaining the concepts. If you're an anglophone like myself, his accent might be a little hard to understand. Overall nice guy but not a great teacher.

I took him for LIN1710 and LIN1720 back to back. Hes a very nice guy, but he mostly reads off the powerpoints which arent always very clear themselves. The instructions on the practical worksheets and take home exams are ambiguous at best. Linguistics is obviously a complicated subject, but he does not convey it well.

He's a very kind prof, passionate about the subject, but isn't rly captivating when teaching (even he said it himself "je suis un peu plate et monotone jle sais"... 4 papers (hw), 1 midterm & final.... linguistics is specific in some fields so he's very picky when grading, gotta have the right term, not even a synonym... Is sometimes unclear

Really bad teacher. His classes are not interesting at all. He only reads the slides, he is not able to properly correct the students homework/exams. Most of the time he can't answer the students questions correctly. GOODLUCK

I had two classes with Gustavo LIN1710 and LIN1720 and it was the worst decision of my life. He is very unclear and marks super hard. if you ask a question in class he will read the answer off his power point slides (which he reads off of each lecture so you may as well teach yourself). The TAs weren't very useful either.

The power points are just heavy, he repeats himself a lot which kinda leads to total confusing. He answers your questions with more questions, and he basically makes you feel like your incompetent when you make him repeat himself during the lectures. Thank god for the TA in that class and the assignments because the exams were impossible...

I had Gustavo for two classes in my first year: Linguistics 1720 and 2720. He is very unclear and goes over complicated concepts quickly. When we don't understand, he says "How!?" and then re-explains it in the exact same way. His powerpoints are so cluttered. I got an A or A+ on every assignment and then somehow failed the exam. Our TA retaught us
Lots of work for sure. Make sure you dont skip classes and go to the DGDs (that saved me!)
Lots of work but make sure you go to the DGDs!!
Phono is tough but I really enjoyed prof Beritognolo's teaching and his TA was very helpful. She's funny and caring, she doesn't let you go until you get it!!

His powerpoints are heavy and tests are hard. He seems intimidating in class, but I went to his office hours a few times and was really nice and supportive. DGDs are very important if you want to pass!

This prof knows a lot about linguistics but he's not very clear or organized and with the content being quite complex, it gets confusing. But we were allowed cheat sheets on midterms and a couple papers that helped your GPA. He's not the warmest person either. The content is interesting though. Perfect knowledge of French is a must.

He was an okay prof, can sometimes be hard to understand him in class, but that's why you got DGDs and office hours.  Posts his slides on BB. His midterms and TPs are very similar to the content presented at the DGDs, so be sure to go!  Overall, read the slides, do the exercices in the DGDs and you are sure to get a good mark in class.

He was a decent prof, powerpoints were clear. So you don't really have to do the readings. But the lectures were really long and boring. Mostly because the content itself was boring so not his fault. He has an accent too, so if French is not your first language it might be a struggle. The dgds are extremely important!
